title: New Mexico High School Soccer Rankings
text:
New Mexico High School Soccer Rankings Kaitlyn Glass NMPreps.com Staff Writer 
Each Monday on NMPreps.com we rank the Top 25 Soccer Teams, both boys and girls are updated as of October 5th, 2015. Sign Up For A Premium Subscription Now - Just 33 cents a day! Team of the Week: Socorro Girls (14-0-1) The Socorro Girls team marches on without any losses so far this season. This week they knocked in 7 goals against both Rehoboth and Ruidoso. They have mercy ruled a team 3 times this season and their biggest victory came against Valencia where they defeated the Jaguars 3-2. The Warriors should easily win their district, which they kick off this week against Silver. NMPreps.com Top 25 Boys Soccer Rankings NMPreps.com Top 25 Girls Soccer Rankings #1 Albuquerque Academy (11-1-1) Beat St. Pius and Eldorado #5 Eldorado (8-5) Blanked Manzano, Lost to La Cueva #6 Sandia (8-3-2) Beat Cleveland and Santa Fe #8 Atrisco Heritage (9-5) Beat Rio Grande and West Mesa #9 Clovis (13-3) Beat Hobbs and Sandia Prep #10 Las Cruces (10-3-2) #1 La Cueva (11- 1-1) Mercy Ruled Highland, Tied Eldorado #2 St. Pius X (12-2) #3 Eldorado (10-2-1) Blanked Manzano, Tied La Cueva #4 Rio Rancho (8-5-2) Lost to Rio Rancho, Beat Cleveland #6 Farmington (12-2) Mercy Ruled Navajo Prep and Rehoboth #8 Albuquerque (10-2-1) Beat Valley and Rio Grande #9 Cleveland (8-5-1) Beat Volcano , Lost to Cibola #10 Volcano Vista (7-4-1) Boys Player of the week Girls Player of the Week Aiden Cserhat - Taos Genevieve Telles - Alamogordo Aiden Cserhat has been on the radar for a few years now and he is taking his senior season way beyond any expectations people had of him. On Monday, Cserhat scored a very impressive 10 goals against Bernalillo and assisted the two other goals to give the Tigers a 12-2 victory over the Spartans. With an average of 3.2 goals a game, Cserhat has already scored 35 goals in 11 games and has 18 assists on the season. Watch for Cserhat is make some noise in his district. With only two losses so far, the Alamogordo girls soccer team is off to a nice start with the help of Senior Forward Genevieve Telles. She's knocked in 16 goals this season and has near a dozen assists. Tuesday, Alamogordo took on a strong Carlsbad side and only one goal was scored. Telles had the game winner to get past the Carlsbad keeper to give the Tigers their 12th win on the season.
